document.short_description:
Chef's Corner at 2 Moons featuring Chef Taiyaba


Chef Taiyaba unveils the secrets of Lucknowi cuisine during our Hands-on Lucknowi Cuisine Experience. Join us for an unforgettable afternoon of culinary delights and cultural immersion.


📅 Date: May 18th  

🕛 Time: 12pm - 3pm  


In association with Campo Viejo, we're thrilled to enhance your experience with an exclusive Wine Tasting and Pairing session. Savor the finest wines expertly paired with each dish, curated to elevate your taste buds and enrich your senses.



🍽️ Menu Highlights:


Tawa Kawabs:

  • Galawati Kabab (Mutton)
  • Bhuni Kaleji (Chicken Liver)

Deep Fry:

  • Chapli Kabab (Chicken)

Grill:

  • Til ke Prawns/ Anardana Jhinga
  • Bihari Kabab
  • Amritsari Fish Tikka

Accompaniments:

  • Chutney
  • Salad
  • Breads


🍷 Tasting and Pairing with -

- Campo Viejo Tempranillo 

- Campo Viejo Blanco


Terms and Conditions -

  • Ticket sales are final and non-refundable, available online only through designated platforms.

  • Alcoholic beverages are served only to legal drinkers.
  • Attendees consent to being photographed or recorded for promotional purposes.
  • Unforeseen circumstances may lead to event postponement, rescheduling, or cancellation, with efforts made for ticket transfers.

document.short_description:
Sandwich Shop the Conservatory!

Indulge in a two-day ‘Sandwich Shop’ at the Conservatory showcasing the culinary mastery of Chef Christopher Fernandes and Delzad. Come, grab, eat & go!


MENU FOR THE SANDWICH SHOP 


1.⁠ ⁠Monte Cristo (₹845)

Smoked homemade ham, aged cheddar, egg dipped (slice white loaf) 


2.⁠ ⁠Brisket Grill Cheese (₹1040)

18hrs smoked Brisket grilled cheese, brioche loaf, honey mustard, caramelised onions, smoked scaromza, pickles, and bonemarrow butter.


3.⁠ ⁠Spicy Chicken Donut (₹845)

Grilled Chicken s/w ( honey chipotle grilled chicken leg, smoked cream cheese, donut, truffle honey) -


4.⁠ ⁠Mojo Pork Sandwich (₹845)

pulled mojo pork, potato bun, smoked buffalo-style hot sauce, pickles 


5.⁠ ⁠Umame Mushroom (₹715)

Wild mix mushrooms, shitake miso, mozzarella 


6.⁠ ⁠Burrata Baguette (₹682)

Roast eggplant, smoked pepper tapenade, baby Burrata, Balsamic glaze, rocket

account_data.company_description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

document.booking_confirmation_message:
Hi there!


We are so excited to take you on an exciting journey, travelling back in time, visiting an era gone by!


Here is the link to our location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/cPznXQ7hgfugF5sf8?g_st=iw


We will need a minimum of 15 individuals to conduct the tour. Incase there is a cancellation due to the numbers, we will let you know 48 hours before the day of the event.


A few things to keep in mind. As most of these vehicles are over a 100 years old and extremely delicate, we do not allow for guests to sit inside, however you are most welcome to take photographs.

As the tour involves a lot of walking through an estate surrounded by a beautiful canopy of trees, please wear comfortable shoes.


We can't wait to share our portal into the past with you!


See you soon!


Warmly,

Rupali

document.name: Slow Tide at The Conservatory
document.short_description:
Slow Tide at The Conservatory

Interpreting the Indian coastline in 5 plates


Slow Tide, once a small fishing enclave, geographically, and socially, withdrawn from mainstreams of otherworldliness. Discovered and embraced by a global gathering, bringing about the ‘Anjuna Commune’. Free spirits, making their way across exotic Asia on an adventure-filled land route, seeking the unconventional. Growing up here, ‘Anjunkars’ understand that it’s okay to live a life others don’t understand. 

Founded by Neil Dsouza, a Goan living in Bombay who moved back to Goa during the pandemic. Slow Tide, conceived during the pandemic redefines the Anjuna Shack. The successful revival of Anjuna's hippie culture by award-winning Architect Palinda Kannangara is reflected in the space, which changes "Fable" to "Table." Born in Rajagiriya, Sri Lanka, Palinda’s contextual sensitivity and experimental use of material carried our story forward. Inspired by frequent stays with us over the years, the site has become a generator of all ideas, designs never frozen but continuing to evolve. 


Vegetarian Menu

Pineapple & Grapes Sasam

Chilli-Lime Rubbed Pineapple & Grapes Sasam Salad with Curried Cashew Sauce & Caramel Rice Puff


Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran Tostada

Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran with Fermented Bean Pure & Poppy Seeds Crumble


Chiapas Grilled New Corn

Charred New Corn with Borracha New Cron with Goat cheese, Pickled lime Salsa & Puffed Jowar


Wild Mushroom Caldine Momos

Wild Mushroom Momos with Caldine Curry, Radish-Peanut Oistou & Lime Oil


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola


Non- Vegetarian Menu

Red Snapper Crudo

Red Snapper Ceviche with Chilli-Tamarind Sauce & Seaweed Rice Crisp


Back Waters Crab Cake

Green Pepper & Betel Leaf Spiced Crab Cake with Cilantro-Green Apple Chutney & Recheado Aioli


Ceylon Pork Curry Taco

Sri lankan Blackened Spiced Pork Belly Curry & Pol Roti With Sambol


Mutton Alooni Bhaat

Goan Mutton (Meat & Bone) Stew with Indrayani Rice Khichadi & Muttton Pickle


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola


Terms and Conditions :

document.short_description:
About the movie


"Dead Poets Society" is a coming-of-age drama film directed by Peter Weir and released in 1989. Set in the conservative Welton Academy, an elite all-boys preparatory school in Vermont in 1959, the story follows a group of students and their English teacher, John Keating, portrayed by Robin Williams.

document.name: 'Fantastic Mr. Fox' Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
document.short_description:
Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids!


Join us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this while cozying up with your family at the studio.


Fantastic Mr. Fox is a stop-motion animated film directed by Wes Anderson, released in 2009, and based on the children's novel of the same name by Roald Dahl. The film follows the story of Mr. Fox, voiced by George Clooney, a cunning and charismatic fox who lives with his wife, Mrs. Fox, voiced by Meryl Streep, and their son, Ash, voiced by Jason Schwartzman, in a cozy underground home.


Event Highlights

Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.Cultivate Cultural Curiosity: Spark interest in world cinema and inspire exploration of different cultures through the enchantment of film.Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.


Why Attend?

Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling. Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity. Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema. Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!


Terms and Conditions:

document.name: Wine Tasting: A Sparkling Sundowner
document.short_description:
Bangalore wine lovers! How does sipping on chilled, delicious bubblies and unwinding on a Sunday evening sound like? We call it the perfect plan! This month, Sommelier Devati (from Drink With D) has put together an exciting wine-tasting theme: A Sparkling Sundowner, at Swwing, Indiranagar. We're bringing 5 unique (and fabulous) sparkling wines from around the world under one roof for you to decode, sip and savour.


If you like drinking bubblies, this evening will introduce you to diverse sparkling wine styles worldwide. Expect something new. Something different. Something unexpected! Here's what we'll taste:

  1. A Champagne from France (yes, the most iconic style!)
  2. A Rosé Prosecco from Italy (Italy's famous sparkling)
  3. A Cava from Spain (rare, flavourful and refreshing)
  4. A rosé sparkling from Portugal (yes, you heard that right)
  5. + A surprise sparkling (you'll never guess where this one's from!)


5 wines. A cheat sheet to the fascinating world of sparkling wines. A bunch of delicious small plates from Swwing's kitchen. And a fun evening of discovering new flavours and new wine friends! 20 seats only. Join us NOW.

default_section.label: What's included
default_section.text:
90ml tasting portions of 5 imported wines selected for the evening
Small plates from Swwing's kitchen
An evening of fun, experiential learning on wines

default_section.text: Any additional à la carte menu orders

document.booking_confirmation_message:
I am super excited to see you at the upcoming "Exploring Tarot: What is Tarot and Pathfinding Workshop".


The session is aimed at helping you identify if Tarot is something you should learn. For this, I need you to be prepared to share "Why you are learning Tarot?". There is no right or wrong answer here, when you identify why you want to learn something your journey towards that will be more fulfilling. Also, whenever you enrol for my course we will weave that into how you learn! You don't need to be prepared for anything else.


We will also during the course go over 1 to 2 cards to understand my style of teaching. The course starts on time, please can i request you to be there a few mins ahead. The last 20 to 30 mins will be dedicated to questions you may have. 


I hope your Tarot Journey is the most fulfilling. See you soon!!!


Loads of HAPPINESS ALWAYS! 🌸🌙🌸

Natasha

During the session we will only cover my teaching style and if that may be aligned with what you have in mind. We will not be going over the meanings of cards during this session.


The session will primarily be based on understanding what Tarot is.

No-show Policy:

document.name: Enjoy Old Monk with Strangers

custom_questions.question: Your favourite bar (anywhere in the world)

document.short_description:
For many fans, Old Monk rum is more than just a beverage—it's a nostalgic symbol of cherished memories and traditions.

People who love Old Monk often have stories to share about memorable experiences they've had while enjoying the rum. These stories could range from travels to places where Old Monk is popular to special occasions celebrated with friends and family.

Expect conversations about the nostalgia associated with Old Monk.

Overall, a gathering of Old Monk Rum lovers promises to be a spirited and convivial affair, filled with lively conversation, shared experiences, and, of course, plenty of delicious rum to enjoy.

Come #takeaseat

Taking inspiration from Bengaluru, her history, geography, culture, and most importantly her stories, love.OORU was born as an identity rooted in Bengaluru and all it has to offer.

document.short_description:
Woodcut Printing Beginners Workshop - by Studio Sakura


We’ll be teaching a black and white composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you can choose from the references we have.


You take home your carved block with 1 print. If you wish to print more editions, you can print it at our studio using our etching press in Brigade road. 🖼️


✨All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. 


No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.

Join us to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.


Studio Sakura- Art Studio

Run by artists Monica & Kapila. Follow them on Instagram @studiosakura.blr

document.cancellation_policy:
Refunds:

Refunds will be issued only in cases where the event is cancelled by the organizers. Refund requests made by attendees will be considered up to 2 days prior to the event date. A processing fee may apply to refund requests initiated by attendees. Refunds will be processed within 2 business days after approval.

Cancellations:

Attendees must notify the organizers of any cancellations at least 2 days before the event date. Cancellations made after the specified deadline may not be eligible for a refund. The organizers reserve the right to cancel or reschedule the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In such cases, attendees will be notified promptly, and refunds will be issued accordingly.

Transfer of Tickets:

Tickets are non-transferable without prior approval from the organizers. Requests for ticket transfers must be made in writing and approved by the organizers.

No-show Policy:

Attendees who do not show up for the event without prior notice will not be eligible for a refund. By registering for the event, attendees agree to abide by the refund and cancellation policy outlined above. The organizers reserve the right to amend or update this policy as necessary.

document.name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
document.short_description:
Start your day right with a scrumptious breakfast.

But it's not just about the food! It's about fostering connections and creating memorable moments. Meet new acquaintances, and enjoy engaging conversations over steaming cups of filter coffee & crisp dosas.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to kick off your day with a hearty breakfast and uplifting conversations. Mark your calendar

We look forward to sharing this delightful morning with you! #takeaseat

Travel often has a way of bringing people together, and a travel tales table is no exception. Who knows, you might leave the meetup having made new friends with whom you can plan future adventures or even travel together.

See you soon!

document.name: Share Travel Tales with Strangers
document.short_description:
Travel often has a way of bringing people together, and a travel tales meetup is no exception. Who knows, you might leave the meetup having made new friends with whom you can plan future adventures or even travel together.

Despite being strangers initially, sharing travel stories can create a sense of connection and camaraderie among participants. You'll likely find common ground with others who share your passion for exploration and discovery.

Each person at the meetup will likely have their own unique travel tales to share. From epic adventures to serendipitous encounters, you can expect to hear a wide range of fascinating stories from different parts of the world.

#takeaseat

1 Beverage (hot or cold)
1 Food (savoury or sweet)

document.name: Kids Playdate - Ultimate Dino Party
document.short_description:
Ticket Includes All Activities by The LooRoo Club for One Kid and One accompanying parent


BengaLooRoo plays at The Courtyard!


We’re bringing the Ultimate Dino Party to Courtyard Playdate, this month! 


Let’s take the journey through Earth's ancient past with our young explorers! 

There will be fossil excavation, Dino egg craft, and art from the prehistoric times! 


There will be stomping, chomping and roaring!


Age: 4-8 years

Venue: At the Yard!


Terms and Conditions


  • The management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.
  • Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.
  • No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.
  • Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.
  • The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.
  • Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.
  • Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.

document.instructions_from_experience_provider: We will start from Bangalore Tipu sultan Fort, walk down the KR market with a brief history about the place. Amazing authentic breakfast in an old restaurant and depart from KR market
document.name: Bengaluru Through Its Market – the “Pete” walk
document.short_description:
The heart of every Indian city is bustling with markets teaming with life and economic activity. The Pete (City Market) area in Bengaluru is the epicentre of business and trade for the locals of the city and beyond. Trading in the Pete is geographically divided by the commodity one wishes to buy or sell. Akkipete (Rice Market), Aralepete (Cotton Market), Balepete (Bangle Market), Chikka Pete (Small Market), Dodda Pete (Big/wholesale Market), Nagarath Pete (Jewellers market) so on and so forth. As you’ve rightly guessed Bangalore had a market for every commodity that you can imagine!


On this walk, we’ll give you an insight into the markets of Bengaluru and how the trading communities of the city work cohesively to help support the city’s need. Traditionally the traders in the Pete “market” comprised of both local and migrant people from trading communities. This also means that you get to meet people from various walks of life who’ve made Bengaluru their home and the ones who have learnt their trade from their forefathers and have built a sustainable livelihood supporting the current economy.


Here’s what you can expect to see on your walk….

  • The remnants of a palace that once belonged to Tipu Sultan
  • Learn of the first ever “rocket” that was used in battle and formed the basis for future warfare
  • Visit an old Hindu temple – the “Kote Venkataramana Temple” with influences of the wealthy Vijayanagara Empire.
  • Walk around the famed flower market, wrap your senses with colour and fragrances. The market is a photographer’s delight.
  • Visit a weaver to learn about hand and mechanical weaving that makes some of the intricate designs on silks.
  • Enjoy a scrumptious plantain leaf meal at a local joint that feeds the traders of the market.

Who can do this tour?

This tour is for anyone with a keen interest in walking through the bylanes of Bengaluru, going off the beaten path and learning about the city’s truly local way of life. A contrast of the old and the new all amalgamated into a half day tour through the markets of the city. This tour is ideal if you are someone who wants to immerse yourself in understanding the “local” way of life.

Physically, this is not an intensive walk making it doable for anyone who wishes to explore Bangalore through its bylanes. Just be warned that the streets are bustling with loads of people and a lot of sights, sounds, and smells.

default_section.label: What's included
default_section.text:
Entrance fees to all sites mentioned
Local English speaking guide
Snacks and food as mentioned in the itinerary
Support en route during the cycle trail
All taxes

default_section.label: What's not
default_section.text:
Bottled water
Alcoholic beverages
Any personal expenses
Anything not mentioned in the “Includes” section
